title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 November 2011 - XWiki
content:
09:43 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* r9d5bbc7 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-ui/src/main/resources/ExtensionCode/ExtensionAuthorsDisplayer.xml : XWIKI-7114: Improve XWiki Repository UI ...  
09:57 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <Denis> has quit  
10:33 <+sburjan> hello everyone  
10:33 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <+sburjan> I am looking to extend Dashboard documentation. Only documentation I found about Dashboards/Gadgets is on extensions.xwiki.org. shouldn't we have at least a link mention on platform, pointing to extensions ?  
10:48 <vmassol> Denis: good morning. I'm committing changes in the CM and ECM for Provider support and I've modified a bit what you committed. Please have a look and tell me if it's ok.  
10:48 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r7deda9c / (9 files in 6 dirs): XCOMMONS-58: Add support for JSR330's Provider ...  
10:48 <vmassol> sburjan: we should already have it  
10:48 <vmassol> let me check  
10:48 <+Denis> vmassol: good morning, I will have look  
10:49 <vmassol> sburjan: it's supposed to be listed automaitcally here: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features  
10:49 <vmassol> (in the Bundled applications section)  
10:49 <vmassol> sburjan: in which app is it located?  
10:50 <+sburjan> vmassol: I don't think it's in an app. it is documented as Dashboard Macro in extensions.xwiki.org  
10:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think there's a problem here: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features  
10:50 <vmassol> it lists application manager for XE is that normal?  
10:50 <+sburjan> I want to add User Dashboard documentation, and I don't have a place toadd it :)  
10:50 <vmassol> s/application/wiki/  
10:51 <vmassol> sburjan: it is an app  
10:51 <vmassol> let me check where the pages are, they're probbaly in XE which is the issue  
10:51 <vmassol> actually it's split in several places:  
10:52 <vmassol> - Dashboard page in XE, home page in XE  
10:52 <vmassol> - user dashboard in Admin app  
10:52 <+sburjan> Searched for "dashboards" on xwiki.org, but I got nothing relevant, only Test Reports and other irrelevant stuff  
10:52 <vmassol> the macro is in XE too  
10:52 <vmassol> so we need to fix this  
10:53 <vmassol> give me 5mn to think about it  
10:53 <+sburjan> ok, I'm starting a meeting in 5 minutes, talk after I'm done  
10:55 <vmassol> sburjan: ok ping me when you're done  
11:02 <vmassol> has quit  
11:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <vmassol> Denis: I'm improving the ECM code a bit based on your remark  
11:52 <vmassol> (this is a fyi)  
11:58 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <+tmortagne> vmassol: don't know, maybe application manager does not have the right "bundled with"  
12:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep maybe, didn't check  
12:04 <vmassol> it used to have the correct one before though  
12:04 <vmassol> checking  
12:05 <vmassol> indeed it's not correct, fixing  
12:09 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r0faebac / xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-component/xwiki-commons-component-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/component/embed/EmbeddableComponentManager.java : \* XCOMMONS-57: Add a new Disposable interface to allow the component manager to properly unregister singleton components. ...  
12:19 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:57 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r6b06e2e / (2 files in 2 dirs): \* XCOMMONS-57: Add a new Disposable interface to allow the component manager to properly unregister singleton components. ...  
13:13 <+sburjan> vmassol: ping  
13:13 <vmassol> sburjan: give me 10 mn  
13:13 <+sburjan> ok  
13:13 <vmassol> sburjan: I've sent a mail btw you can start by replying to it :)  
13:29 <mflorea> has quit  
13:35 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r6056078 / (2 files in 2 dirs): XCOMMONS-58: Add support for JSR330's Provider ...  
13:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: the filter on autjhor doesn't to work anymore  
13:44 <vmassol> \*author  
13:45 <+tmortagne> filter ? you mean the suggest ?  
13:45 <+tmortagne> vmassol:  
13:45 <vmassol> nope  
13:45 <vmassol> I'm talking about the livetable author column filter  
13:45 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there was no filter at all, I set it to text type this morning  
13:46 <vmassol> well it's not working  
13:46 <vmassol> (strange I was pretty sure you could filter by author before)  
13:47 <+tmortagne> well it's a normal static list so I don't really know why it's not working  
13:47 <+tmortagne> it just have a custom displayer but that should not impact the livetable filter since I guess it's doing a database request  
13:47 <vmassol> well  
13:47 <vmassol> the LT will filter on the original value in the DB  
13:48 <vmassol> and not on the displayed names  
13:48 <vmassol> but even with this it's still not wokring for some reason  
13:49 <vmassol> sburjan: did you see my mail about the dashboard app?  
13:51 <vmassol> hmm seems I've broken platform, checking locally  
14:04 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r951380a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-component/xwiki-platform-component-multi/src/main/java/org/xwiki/component/internal/DelegateComponentManager.java : XCOMMONS-58: Add support for JSR330's Provider ...  
14:10 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r55ed067 / (2 files): XCOMMONS-58: Add support for JSR330's Provider ...  
14:18 <vmassol> lucaa: hi. Would be great to have your input on the dashboard app I've proposed on the list (since you're the creator of this feature) :)  
14:19 <+sburjan> vmassol: I have replied  
14:29 <+lucaa> vmassol: done  
14:32 <vmassol> sburjan: I didn't see your reply  
14:32 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <+sburjan> it's right after tmortagne's reply  
14:33 <vmassol> hmm for some reason I don't have it  
14:33 <+sburjan> tmortagne, me, Denis  
14:34 <vmassol> has someone else received sburjan's mail?  
14:34 <vmassol> let me check markmail  
14:35 <vmassol> sburjan: it's not there either :)  
14:35 <vmassol> http://markmail.org/thread/z5fovfn5e4qeftbn  
14:35 <+sburjan> I used the quick reply button from GMail, maybe it's not good for replying to lists. I will send a reply again  
14:35 <vmassol> check your mail  
14:35 <vmassol> where it was sent  
14:35 <vmassol> (sent folder)  
14:36 <+tmortagne> sburjan: that's what I used too  
14:36 <+tmortagne> you are talking about dashboard vote ?  
14:36 <+tmortagne> don't have you mail either if that's it  
14:37 <+tmortagne> indeed it's dashboard mail  
14:37 <+sburjan> yes, about the dashboard vote  
14:37 <+sburjan> ok, I will reply again  
14:37 <+sburjan> vmassol: I have it in the send folder, also in the dev list. odd  
14:37 <vmassol> that's normal  
14:38 <vmassol> but check the from and to  
14:38 <vmassol> you need to be registered to send mail  
14:38 <vmassol> (the email you've used)  
14:38 <+tmortagne> sburjan: maybe you sent it to some user instead of the list  
14:38 <+tmortagne> or maybe with the wrong mail indeed  
14:38 <+sburjan> to: [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
14:39 <+sburjan> check now please, I have re-sent it  
14:40 <+tmortagne> I have it  
14:40 <+tmortagne> you can compare it with your other mail  
14:40 <+tmortagne> still possible it's a bug in gmail ;)  
14:42 <+sburjan> odd, they look exactly the same  
14:46 <+tmortagne> vmassol: re livetable and author filetring, maybe it's because of "Multiple Select", I thin kit makes the list being stored as a real list and not as a string  
14:47 <+tmortagne> (even if "Relational Storage" is not checked)  
14:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: could it be http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5146 ?  
14:49 <+tmortagne> well it's not a DBListclass  
14:49 <vmassol> ok  
14:49 <vmassol> you could ask jerome  
14:49 <+tmortagne> I think XWIKI-5146 is more about provideing a list of possible values in the livetable  
14:50 <+tmortagne> instead of a query search query  
14:50 <+tmortagne> like we have with static list  
14:55 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* r55648ab / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-ui/src/main/resources/ExtensionCode/ExtensionSheet.xml : XWIKI-7114: Improve XWiki Repository UI ...  
14:55 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* rbe239fc / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-ui/src/main/resources/Extension/WebHome.xml : XWIKI-7114: Improve XWiki Repository UI ...  
14:55 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* r1993758 / (2 files): XWIKI-7114: Improve XWiki Repository UI ...  
15:31 <+sburjan> vmassol: waiting for the vote to finalize, and we'll talk tomorrow to see where should I add the documentation  
15:32 <+sburjan> I also have to document Message Stream, because I found no documentation for it  
15:38 <vmassol> has quit  
15:38 <+mflorea> tmortagne: how can I escape " inside the value of a macro parameter?  
15:39 <+mflorea> i.e. {{include document="docNameWithQuotes"/}}  
15:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:39 <+tmortagne> mflorea: did you tried ~ ? everything is supposed to be based on ~ in xwiki/2.x syntaxe  
15:39 <vmassol> sburjan: I'm coding it right now  
15:39 <+sburjan> vmassol: ok  
15:40 <+tmortagne> mflorea: do you know what you want to escape (hardcoded) or is it a variable you don't know the content in your code ?  
15:41 <+mflorea> tmortagne: it works with ~, thanks. I didn't tried it because I though it is used only to escape special xwiki/2.0 syntax characters, like preventing \* from generating a list item.  
15:42 <+tmortagne> mflorea: wiki macro is wiki syntax ;)  
15:42 <+tmortagne> the only other escaping you find is the one for reference but it's reference syntaxe in this case and not wiki syntax  
15:42 <+mflorea> sure, but I'm not escaping {{ but the value of a macro param  
15:42 <+tmortagne> still  
15:42 <+tmortagne> parameter is a syntaxe too  
15:42 <+tmortagne> syntax  
15:42 <+mflorea> yes  
15:43 <+tmortagne> you will not put the parameters with the same syntax in confluence or xwiki/1.0 for example  
15:43 <+mflorea> is just that I wrongly thought it isn't  
15:43 <+mflorea> but, in my case the value is not static, so I need to escape it  
15:43 <+tmortagne> playing with String#replace should do it I guess  
15:44 <+mflorea> there was a plan for adding an escapetool.xwiki method at some point  
15:44 <+mflorea> I guess it wasn't implemented  
15:44 <+tmortagne> mflorea: yes but this is for content  
15:44 <+tmortagne> so it would not escape "  
15:44 <+tmortagne> it would need to support context  
15:44 <+mflorea> right  
15:45 <+tmortagne> I think sdumitriu added it already  
15:45 <+mflorea> ok, thanks, I'll play with String.replace  
15:46 <+tmortagne> mflorea: it's a bit of a pain with velocity but in groovy you could create a MacroBlock and then use the current syntax renderer  
15:46 <+tmortagne> actually no  
15:46 <+tmortagne> you would not even use the renderer :)  
15:46 <+tmortagne> just directly return the block  
15:47 <+mflorea> yes, but I'm in velocity for the moment  
15:48 <+sburjan> where can I see the whole list of silk icons ?  
15:48 <+tmortagne> a pity there is no return in velocity since with a nice velocity API oriented API to create blocks you could have done it very easily  
15:49 <+tmortagne> I could introduce a standard $return variable maybe  
15:50 <+sburjan> ok, found  
15:53 <vmassol> sburjan: here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HImages  
15:53 <+sburjan> thanks  
16:10 <+sburjan> how can I find the mappings to a silk icon ? I mean the corresponding syntax for a certain icon.  
16:11 <vmassol> sburjan: I don't understand  
16:11 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HImages isn't good enough?  
16:12 <+sburjan> I want to use silk icons bundled in XE. The corresponding syntax to a certain silk icon. Something like (/), (x), etc  
16:14 <+sburjan> or we don't have all icons mapped ?  
16:19 <+sburjan> because I don't know how to reference a silk icon from the xwiki 2.1 syntax  
16:25 <vmassol> sburjan: sorry was otp  
16:25 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HImages  
16:25 <vmassol> it explains how to display an icon  
16:26 <+sburjan> ok, found  
16:26 <vmassol> now if you want to add new mappings  
16:26 <+sburjan> I wasn't searching for icon :)  
16:26 <vmassol> you can check xwiki.properties  
16:26 <vmassol> (I don't think it's documented yet)  
16:26 <vmassol> you can redefine or add new mappings  
16:27 <+sburjan> ok, and if I don't have privileges ? I want to add (flag\_green) but does not because I guess there is no mapping, so I should use URL instead  
16:28 <vmassol> if you're not admin you're not allowed to do this  
16:29 <+sburjan> i'm not  
16:29 <+sburjan> an admin  
16:29 <vmassol> then contact your admin  
16:29 <vmassol> :)  
16:29 <+sburjan> too bad, now I have to use some URL to add these icons, instead of using the internal mechanism  
16:30 <+sburjan> because (/) or (x) are mapped by default  
16:30 <vmassol> your admin doesn't allow to add a new mapping?  
16:30 <+sburjan> It should allow, but I think he is busy :)  
16:30 <vmassol> ah ok  
16:31 <vmassol> actually there's supposed to be a way to configure this from the wiki  
16:31 <+sburjan> but why didn't re autmatically map the values http://www.famfamfam.com/lab/icons/silk/previews/index\_abc.pn from  
16:31 <vmassol> but I doubt it's working  
16:31 <vmassol> map to what?  
16:32 <+sburjan> map to something that they can be used from syntax  
16:32 <vmassol> they can be used from syntax already  
16:32 <vmassol> as I said aboe  
16:32 <+sburjan> like (/) means accept (the first icon)  
16:32 <vmassol> I gave you the link  
16:32 <vmassol> image:icon:<name>  
16:33 <vmassol> now if what you want is shortcuts for all good luck for finding shortcuts… :)  
16:33 <vmassol> (and in addition it's going to slow down a bit the wiki)  
16:33 <vmassol> s/going/may/  
16:34 <vmassol> (flag\_red) is a possibility but not very nice IMO  
16:34 <+sburjan> no, I don't need shortcuts. It worked, thanks  
16:46 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:46 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r8e7121d / (37 files in 19 dirs): XWIKI-7147: Extract the Dashboard feature into a Dashboard Application and module ...  
16:56 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* r90f122a / (4 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7147: Extract the Dashboard feature into a Dashboard Application and module ...  
17:02 <vmassol> hmmm  
17:02 <vmassol> it's likely I broke something this morning, for ex: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-oldcore/998/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki/XWikiTest/testAuthorAfterDocumentCopy/  
17:15 <vmassol> I can reproduce locally but ftm I have no clue what could be the problem  
17:16 <vmassol> ah yes some idea  
17:16 <vmassol> ahah fun  
17:17 <vmassol> we're already using a javax.inject.Provider in our code  
17:18 <vmassol> @ComponentRole  
17:18 <vmassol> public interface QueryExecutorProvider extends Provider<QueryExecutor>  
17:18 <vmassol> {  
17:18 <vmassol>     // No difference from Provider<QueryExecutor>  
17:18 <vmassol>     // TODO: Support Provider<T> in the component system.  
17:18 <vmassol> }  
17:20 <vmassol> so wdyt about breaking backward dependency in the query module?  
17:20 <vmassol> ie remove QueryExecutorProvider  
17:22 <vmassol> otherwise I can cheat and say that we only take into account Provider if there's no @ComponentRole defined in any super interfaces  
17:34 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* ref4734f / (4 files in 4 dirs): XCOMMONS-58: Add support for JSR330's Provider ...  
17:34 <vmassol> ok I've unilateraly decided to break backward compat…. let me know if it's a mistake  
17:42 <@cjdelisle> There are other things that extend Provider<>  
17:42 <@cjdelisle> \*which  
17:42 <vmassol> ah?  
17:42 <@cjdelisle> I know I wrote a few, let me check.  
17:42 <vmassol> I should have checked, checking now  
17:43 <@cjdelisle> ahh only one and it's not relesed yet  
17:44 <@cjdelisle> public interface TransactionProvider<T> extends Provider<StartableTransactionRunnable<T>>  
17:44 <@cjdelisle> ^that's not committed  
17:44 <vmassol> just checked  
17:44 <vmassol> and I can't find anything else  
17:44 <vmassol> :)  
17:44 <@cjdelisle> I really need to make a branch for all of that stuff, it started out being small -- 2 weeks later still not done :|  
17:44 <vmassol> now you can get rid of TransactionProvider<T>  
17:45 <@cjdelisle> Indeed.  
17:53 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
17:58 <vmassol> guys enteprrise ui tests have been failing since the 10th of November  
17:58 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/  
17:59 <vmassol> do we have a BM?  
17:59 <vmassol> !search Roster  
17:59 <vmassol> it appears we don't  
18:00 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think this is for you:  
18:00 <vmassol> Caused by: javax.xml.bind.JAXBException: "org.xwiki.extension.repository.xwiki.model.jaxb" doesnt contain ObjectFactory.class or jaxb.index  
18:00 <vmassol> found in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/581/testReport/org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4/JUnit4Provider/org\_xwiki\_test\_ui\_AllTests/  
18:05 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok will look at it  
18:06 <+tmortagne> I need to update repository intergation test anyway  
18:06 <+tmortagne> with all the changes I made ecently  
18:06 <+tmortagne> in test-ui it's very weird  
18:07 <+tmortagne> since nothing is supposed to use XR there  
18:07 <+tmortagne> the jar is notr even bundled with XE actually  
18:08 <vmassol> platform is back on track :) http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/  
18:14 <+tmortagne> actually this error does not make sense  
18:17 <+tmortagne> I can see theses class exist and are in the classpath  
18:20 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
18:24 <sburjan> has quit
